headline: GE Vernova declares increased first quarter 2026 dividend and increases buyback authorization
summary: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., December 09, 2025--GE Vernova (NYSE: GEV) today announced that its Board of Directors has declared a $0.50 per share quarterly dividend—doubling from a $0.25 quarterly dividend. The quarterly dividend will be payable on February 2, 2026, to shareholders of record as of January 5, 2026. The Board of Directors has also approved a share repurchase authorization increase to $10 billion, from the prior authorization of $6 billion. GE Vernova has spent $3.3 billion of the authorizati

headline: Wall Street Bulls Look Optimistic About GE (GE): Should You Buy?
summary: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), GE (GE) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

headline: GE Vernova Investor Day: The Stakes for the Stock Are Huge
summary: GE Vernova  has become a hot derivative play on the growing demand for electricity coming from power-hungry AI data centers.  Company management meets with investors on Tuesday evening to address the future.  Business execution by Vernova management has been excellent since the company spun out from  GE Aerospace  in early 2024.

headline: Don't Underestimate Inflation - It Will Cost You
summary: Persistent 3-4% inflation is likely the new normal. Read why portfolio vigilance and targeted diversification are essential to generate alpha in this environment.

headline: Ascom appoints David Hale as new CEO
summary: Picture David Hale New CEO of Ascom Holding AG Ad hoc announcement pursuant to Art. 53 LRBaar, Switzerland, December 9, 2025 David Hale, an executive leader with a proven track record and over two decades of technology and industrial expertise, has been appointed by the Board of Directors of Ascom Holding AG as the new CEO of the Ascom Group. David Hale will join Ascom on February 4, 2026. Michael Reitermann will step down as interim CEO at that time and remain an ordinary member of the Board of
